overview_of_class: The Genetic and Molecular Processes Laboratory is a hypothesis driven, discovery based laboratory class. During the quarter, students will be be engaged in a laboratory research project where they will design and implement their own experiments centered around understanding a particular disease. Various laboratory techniqes will be introduced to help answer fundamental aspects of genetic and molecular processes that are involved in disease development.
name: Genetic and Molecular Processes Laboratory
title: SCS BIOL_SCI 220-CN-100 Genetic and Molecular Processes Laboratory

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The Genetic and Molecular Processes Laboratory is a hypothesis driven, discovery based laboratory class. During the quarter, students will be be engaged in a laboratory research project where they will design and implement their own experiments centered around understanding a particular disease. Various laboratory techniqes will be introduced to help answer fundamental aspects of genetic and molecular processes that are involved in disease development.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
To learn experimental techniques and proper implementation of laboratory protocols
To learn the proper methods to design and test experimental hypotheses using a model system
To draw conclusions from analyzed experimental data and explain potential problems

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Class participation, Group work, Research project, Writing assignments, Films / videos, Laboratory exercises

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Attendance, Class Participation, Quizzes, Presentations, Research Project, Writing assignments

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Class materials such as video presentations and scientific articles will be provided by the instructor and will be accessible through Canvas. No additional course materials will required from students.

subject: BIOL_SCI
